class vyra_base.storage.db_access.DbAccess(module_id, db_config_path)¶

Bases: object

Baseclass for database access.

async create_all()¶

Create all database tables that are childen of the SQLAlchemy Base class. This method will create all tables that are defined in the SQLAlchemy Base class. It will also create the tables if they do not exist. This method will not create the tables if they already exist.

Returns:

see DBSTATUS class

Return type:

DBSTATUS

async create_selective(table_structs)¶

Returns:

async get_all(filters=None, order_by=None, limit=None)¶

Read all lines from datatable of database. :type filters: dict :param filters: add filter elements to identify the rows

to be read. Defaults to None.

Parameters:

  • order_by (str, optional) – column name to order the result. Defaults to None.

  • limit (int, optional) – number of lines to be read. Defaults to None.

Returns:

{Status: DBSTATUS, value: Short info, details: Detailed info}

Return type:

dict

async get_by_id(id=-1)¶

Read line from datatable of database by ‘id’.

If the id is -1, the last line will be read. If the id is None, the last line will be read.

Parameters:

id (int, optional) – Private key of the table element to select the row to be read. Defaults to -1.

Returns:

{Status: DBSTATUS, value: Short info, details: Detailed info}

Return type:

dict

Returns:

{Status: DBSTATUS, value: Short info, details: Detailed info}

Return type:

dict

to_dict(obj, exclude=None)¶
async update(data, filters=None)¶

Add new entry to datatable of database on the bottom.

If the table config has a field ‘max_lines’ and the number of lines are greater than this field, the lowest ‘id’ value will be deleted and the new entry will be added by a incremented ‘id’ value.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – Update data in an existing entry

  • id (int) – Private key of the table element to select the row to be updated

Returns:

{Status: DBSTATUS, value: Short info, details: Detailed info}

Return type:

dict

class vyra_base.storage.tb_base.IntEnum(enumtype, *args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: TypeDecorator

impl¶

alias of Integer

process_bind_param(value, dialect)¶

Receive a bound parameter value to be converted.

Custom subclasses of _types.TypeDecorator should override this method to provide custom behaviors for incoming data values. This method is called at statement execution time and is passed the literal Python data value which is to be associated with a bound parameter in the statement.

The operation could be anything desired to perform custom behavior, such as transforming or serializing data. This could also be used as a hook for validating logic.

Parameters:

  • value – Data to operate upon, of any type expected by this method in the subclass. Can be None.

  • dialect – the Dialect in use.

See also

types_typedecorator

_types.TypeDecorator.process_result_value()

process_result_value(value, dialect)¶

Receive a result-row column value to be converted.

Custom subclasses of _types.TypeDecorator should override this method to provide custom behaviors for data values being received in result rows coming from the database. This method is called at result fetching time and is passed the literal Python data value that’s extracted from a database result row.

The operation could be anything desired to perform custom behavior, such as transforming or deserializing data.

Parameters:

  • value – Data to operate upon, of any type expected by this method in the subclass. Can be None.

  • dialect – the Dialect in use.

See also

types_typedecorator

_types.TypeDecorator.process_bind_param()
